japanese: よう、来たぞ。
translation: Hey, I'm here.

japanese: フータロー。
translation: Futaro.

japanese: フー君、いらっしゃい。
translation: Welcome, Fu-kun.

japanese:
どうぞどうぞ！
上杉さんが遊びに来てくれるのは久しぶりですね。
translation:
Please come in!
It's been a while since you came to visit, Uesugi-san.

japanese: 遊びにって。
translation: Visit, you say.

japanese:
俺はいままでも遊びに来てたわけじゃないぞ。
家庭教師の仕事をしに来てきたんだ。
translation:
I've never come here just to visit.
I came to do my job as a private tutor.

japanese: だとしても久しぶりじゃない？
translation: Even so, it's been a while, right?

japanese:
……卒業は決まったし受験勉強も終わった。
来る必要がない。
translation:
...You've already graduated
and finished your entrance exam preparations.
There's no need for me to come.

japanese: そうだねぇ、君のおかげでなんとかなったよ。
translation: Well, thanks to you, we managed to get through it all.

japanese: って、まだお前は決まってないだろ。
translation: But wait, you still don't know yet, do you.

japanese:
いやいや、もう決まってるようなものでしょ？
君が面倒見てくれてるんだしさ。
translation:
No, but it's basically decided, right? 
You took care of us, after all.

japanese:
これから行われる特別試験に合格すれば卒業、
でしたよね？
translation:
If you pass the special exam that's coming up,
you'll graduate, right?

japanese:
うん。
休学扱いだったけど特別措置ってことでね。
学校側が色々配慮してくれたんだ。
translation:
Yeah. I was treated as being on a leave of absence,
but it was a special measure.
The school was considerate in many ways.

japanese:
ただし不合格なら容赦なく留年になるんだ。
予断を許さない状況であることは自覚しろ。
translation:
But if you fail, you'll be held back without mercy.
Be aware that the situation
doesn't allow for any complacency.

japanese: はーい。
translation: Okaaay.

japanese:
君がわざわざ事務所まで
家庭教師に来てくれてるんだからね。
無駄にはできませんって。
translation:
You're coming all the way to the office
to work as a private tutor,
so we can't waste any time.

japanese: 事務所じゃなくて、うちでやればいいじゃない。
translation:
Why don't we just do it at our place
instead of the office?

japanese:
……ここで一花だけ勉強じゃ
集中できないだろうしな。
translation:
...It'd be hard to concentrate on studying
with just Ichika here.

japanese: そうかな。
translation: Is that so?

japanese:
上杉さんがついてれば大丈夫ですよね！
私だって大学に合格させてもらえたんですから。
translation:
Uesugi-san, as long as you're here, it'll be fine!
After all, I was able to get into university
thanks to you.

japanese:
私も、希望通りの学校に合格できたのは
上杉君のおかげです。
一花も大丈夫でしょう。
translation:
I also got into the school I wanted to
thanks to Uesugi-kun.
I'm sure you'll be fine too, Ichika.

japanese: 上杉さん自身もバッチリ合格ですもんね。
translation: And Uesugi-san himself has passed with flying colors.

japanese:
そうね。
フー君は東京の大学に行くから
いなくなっちゃうのね。
translation:
That's right. Fu-kun is going to a university in Tokyo,
so he won't be here anymore.

japanese:
私と二乃は料理の専門学校だし、
いよいよ新しい生活が始まるんだ。
translation:
Nino and I are going to a culinary school,
so it's finally time for our new lives to begin.

japanese:
お互いに違う道へと歩み出して、新しい場所で
新しい関係を築いていくことになりますね。
translation:
We'll each be moving in different directions
and building new relationships in new places.

japanese:
（もうすぐ始まる新しい生活、新しい関係。
　だが、俺たちの関係にはなんの進展もないままだ）
translation:
(A new life and new relationships are about to begin.
 But our relationship hasn't progressed at all.)

japanese:
（年が明け、受験に没頭する傍ら、
　次第に俺の中に膨れ上がっていた感情）
translation:
(As I devoted myself to studying for the entrance exams
 at the beginning of the year,
 emotions began to swell up inside me.)

japanese: （本当に、このままでいいのか？）
translation: (Can I really keep going like this?)

japanese: 俺は、お前たち５人が好きだ。
translation: I really love you five.

japanese:
この６人でずっと、このままの関係で
いられたらと願ってる。
translation:
I hope we can stay in this same relationship forever,
the six of us.

japanese:
（『ずっと、このままの関係で』なんて
　ありえないんじゃないか？）
translation:
(But can we really 
 'stay in this same relationship forever'?)

japanese:
上杉君。
ここは遠慮なく言わせてもらいます。
translation: Uesugi-kun, I'll speak my mind here without hesitation.

japanese:
これは、答えを出さない、ということと同じ。
私には逃げているとしか感じられません。
translation:
Not giving us an answer is the same as running away.
That's the only way I can feel about it.

japanese: （五月の言った通りだったんじゃないか？）
translation: (Wasn't it just as Itsuki said?)

japanese:
（このままの関係で、こいつらのそれぞれの想いを
　放ったまま俺だけが上京するのは、
　まるで逃げるようなものだろ）
translation:
(If I'm the only one going to Tokyo
 while leaving their respective feelings hanging
 like this, it's like I'm running away, isn't it?)

japanese:
（一度は、誰も選ばないと決めた。
　だが――）
translation: (I had decided not to choose anyone, but%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（やはり男として、
　１つの答えを出さなくてはならない）
translation: (As a man, I've just got to come up with an answer.)

japanese:
（今日はそのためにここを訪れたんだ。
　しかし、どう切り出したものか……）
translation:
(That's why I came here today.
 But, how should I bring it up...?)

japanese: 上杉君。
translation: Uesugi-kun.

japanese: あ、ああ、なんだ？
translation: Y-yeah, what is it?

japanese:
それで、今日はどういった用件なのですか？
なにか重要な話があるようでしたが。
translation:
So, what's the purpose of your visit today?
It seemed like there was something important
you wanted to talk about.

japanese:
私もなるべくいて欲しいって話だったから、
仕事を抜け出してこれるタイミングにしたんでしょ？
translation:
You chose a time when I could get away from work,
as you wanted me to be here as well, right?

japanese:
ああ。
悪いな、勉強でも忙しいって時に。
どうしても全員揃っている時に話したかったんだ。
translation:
Yeah.
Sorry, it's just that I'm busy with studying.
I really wanted to talk when everyone was together.

japanese:
ふーん。
相当、重要な話みたいね。
聞かせてもらおうじゃない。
translation:
Hmmm.
It seems like a pretty important topic.
Let's hear it.

japanese:
実は、春休みなんだが。
この６人で卒業旅行に行きたいんだ。
translation:
Well, it's about spring break.
I want the six of us to go on a graduation trip together.

japanese: え？
translation: Huh?

japanese:
（そして、卒業旅行を
　こいつらに対する答えを出す舞台にする――）
translation:
(And, I want to make this graduation trip a stage
 to give them an answer%p-2;――%p;)

japanese:
（もちろん、断られたら
　別の手段を考えなきゃならないが）
translation:
(Of course, if I'm refused,
 I have to think of another way.)

japanese:
まだ一花の卒業は決まっていないが、
お前らの都合がつくようなら、どうだ？
translation:
We don't know if Ichika will graduate yet,
but if it works for you guys, how about it?

japanese:
って、なんだ、その反応は。
そんなに唖然とするような提案か？
translation:
What's with that reaction?
Is it such a shocking proposal?

japanese:
いやまあ確かに、俺はそういうことを言うような
柄じゃないのかもしれないが！
translation:
Ah, look, I know I'm not the kind of person
who says these kinds of things!

japanese:
あっ、違います違います！
ビックリしただけです！
translation: Oh, no, it's not like that! I was just surprised!

japanese: 私たちも同じことを考えてたから。
translation: We were also thinking the same thing.

japanese: は？　そうなのか？
translation: Huh? Really?

japanese:
今日、フー君の話を聞いた後に提案しようと
思ってたのよ。
translation:
I was planning on proposing the idea
after I heard what you wanted to talk about today.

japanese: それは、どういうつもりで……。
translation: What do you mean by that...?

japanese:
どういうって、別に深い意味はないよ。
強いて言うなら思い出作り？
translation:
Well, there's no deep meaning to it.
If anything, it's about making memories, you know?

japanese:
この先、この６人での時間を作るのも
難しくなりそうですから、
ここでいっぱい、楽しい思い出を作りましょう！
translation:
Making time for the six of us in the future
is going to be difficult,
so let's make lots of fun memories here!

japanese: そうか……。
translation: I see...

japanese:
あなたは違うと？
どんなつもりで卒業旅行なんて言い出したんですか？
translation:
What about you?
What were you thinking
when you suggested a graduation trip?

japanese:
い、いやっ！
俺もだ、最後の思い出作りをしようと思ったんだ！
translation:
N-nothing in particular!
I was also thinking about making one last memory!

japanese: ……そうですか。
translation: ...Is that so?

japanese:
では決まりですね！
いやー、話が早くて助かりました。
translation:
Well, it's decided then!
Wow, that was quick. What a relief.

japanese: 行き先は沖縄を考えてるんだけど、いい？
translation:
We were thinking about going to Okinawa,
is that okay?

japanese:
沖縄？
いい場所だとは思うが……。
translation:
Okinawa?
I think it's a good place, but...

japanese: 問題ある？
translation: Is there a problem?

japanese: 旅費が、正直厳しい。
translation: The travel fees. To be honest, they'll be tough.

japanese:
ああ、そういうこと。
まあ出世払いってことでいいんじゃないかな。
translation:
Hmm, I see.
Well, I guess we can split the bill.

japanese:
宿泊先などは、父が手配してくれることに
なっていますので。
translation: Our father will arrange the accommodations, though.

japanese:
は？
じゃあ、もうお父さんの許可ももらってるのか？
translation:
Huh?
So you've already gotten your father's permission?

japanese: ええ、そうよ。
translation: Yep, that's right.

japanese:
……妙に準備がいいな。
俺が断ったらどうする気だったんだ？
translation:
...You seem to be oddly prepared.
What were you going to do if I refused?

japanese:
その時はその時よ。
細かいことは気にするものじゃないわ。
translation:
We would have dealt with it.
You don't need to worry about the details.

japanese:
詳しい日程とかもこっちで決めちゃいますね。
上杉さんは当日、着替えとかの荷物だけ
持ってきてくれたらオッケーです。
translation:
We'll decide on all the details. On the day
of the trip, just bring some clothes
and other necessities. Okay, Uesugi-san?

japanese: わかった……頼む。
translation: Got it... Thanks.

japanese: 任せてください！
translation: Leave it to us!

japanese:
（卒業旅行は無事に決まったわけだが、
　なんだろうか？　この妙な違和感は）
translation:
(The graduation trip has been decided,
 but what is this strange discomfort?)

japanese: （いや、余計なことを考えている場合じゃない）
translation:
(No, I shouldn't be thinking
 about unnecessary things right now.)

japanese:
（舞台は整った。
　だが、その舞台であいつらに告げるべき言葉は
　まだはっきりしていない）
translation:
(The stage is set. However,
 the words that I should declare to them
 on said stage remain unclear.)

japanese:
（卒業旅行までの間に……
　この難問の答えを見つけ出さなくては――）
translation:
(Before this graduation trip...
 I have to find the answer to this difficult question%p-2;――%p;)
